meanings.definition: Convert or attempt to convert (someone) from one religion, belief, or opinion to another.
meanings.sent1: She was proselytising her friend to join her church.
meanings.sent2: The preacher spent hours proselytising to the crowd about his faith.
meanings.sent3: The persistent salesman was proselytising the benefits of his product.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for the new diet plan was proselytising to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The political party was proselytising their manifesto to gain more supporters.

meanings.definition: Advocate or promote (a belief or course of action).
meanings.sent1: He was proselytising for environmental conservation in his community.
meanings.sent2: The celebrity was proselytising for a healthy lifestyle in her latest interview.
meanings.sent3: The teacher was proselytising the importance of reading to her students.
meanings.sent4: The coach was proselytising the value of teamwork to his players.
meanings.sent5: The organization was proselytising for donations to support their cause.
